intro: Omonoia californica, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its vibrant orange or red petals and is part of the Papaveraceae family. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny areas and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its flowers bloom in the spring and early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Omonoia californica is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
